content:
Hey! I am also a newcomer to the Rust language with some background in C++ and C. Currently I am creating a PoC project to deepen my understanding and oh boy, so much new things emerged (probably chose too ambitious project - visualizing realtime audio streams :). I wish to expand upon the language, and fix some of its shortcomings once I get good grasp of all the features (so in a few years :D).

On top of that, I am totally in love with this language and I only sometimes grumble about my struggles with compiler which does a good job of suggesting nice fixes to errors but sometimes falls short of explaining the problem precisely enough (maybe this is where I could help as a newcomer).
Hi, I'm a Firefox dev and long-time Rust user (and minor contributor). I was involved in the very early discussions on error-handling, so of course interested in this :)

Hey Everyone! My name is Drew and I'm a SWE,. I know there is so much I can learn from this language and this community. I'm about to quit my job and take a gap year and want to contribute to this language as much as I can and learn as much as I can. I just saw the blog post for https://blog.rust-lang.org/2020/09/14/wg-prio-call-for-contributors.html and will reach out for more guidance on what I can do to help :)

Hi everyone!

I'm Nelson, I've been mainly a full stack web developer with a focus on backend development.
Most recently I've been working with Kotlin and Go but I keep feeling the urge to learn more low level languages specially Rust, and I don't really know why. :shrug: I might need an intervention.

My Rust experience is still very limited, but i'm working to change that.

Thanks for having me!
Hello! I'm also a Nelson ;) Welcome to Rust!
